In Pakistan, HCV has replaced HBV as the most common cause of cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma. 40, 41 Up to 86% of cases of cirrhosis and 58% of cases of hepatocellular carcinoma in Pakistan have been attributed to HCV. 40, 41, 42 According to the GHE 2015 dataset, hepatitis B accounted for 28·6% of all deaths due to cirrhosis and other chronic liver diseases and for 28·8% of all deaths due to liver cancer in Pakistan, whereas hepatitis C accounted for 44·2% and 51·1% of such deaths, respectively ( table 2).
1 Acute hepatitis B infection caused 49·2%, and acute hepatitis C infection caused 2·3%, of all deaths due to acute hepatitis in Pakistan in 2015.
1 An increased prevalence of either HBV or HCV has been reported in prisoners. 43, 44 HDV has been reported in 16·6–44% of patients with hepatitis B.
